Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style or Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres above two white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion (part of jaws, teeth and tongue remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: The decoration is typical of both the Animal Chalice and Simple Animal Style. Given the size of the sherd, it is impossible to tell whether or not this chalice had any filling ornaments. For parallels regarding the lion, see Lemos, no. 971 from Pitane.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0674) (phase 2)
